newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Chang Hwa Bank cuts time deposit rates.
newsitem.headline: Chang Hwa Bank cuts time deposit rates.

text.p: Chang Hwa Bank, one of Taiwan's "big three" state-run banks, said on Saturday it would cut its time deposits rates from six months to three years by between 0.050 and 0.100 percentage points, effective from Tuesday.
It would also cut its time savings deposits rates for one year to three years by 0.100 percentage points, effective also from Tuesday, the bank said in a statement.
The move followed the rate cuts by Bank of Taiwan, which cut various interest rates from Friday.
Taiwan Cooperative Bank and Farmers Bank of China cut their prime rates, while First Commercial Bank, the other of the "big three" state-run banks, cut various time deposits rates, from Friday.
These banks said the rate cuts reflected the current loose liquidity in the banking system.
